step1.sentence: A small fire broke out in the kitchen of the restaurant during the busy dinner service.

step2.story: Chaos broke out at the concert when the sound system failed and the crowd started pushing toward the exit. Security staff quickly restored order.

step3.story: During the outdoor market, a sudden argument broke out between two vendors over a parking space. Voices got louder and a small crowd gathered to watch. A nearby shop owner stepped in and calmly suggested a solution. Both vendors agreed, the crowd dispersed, and the market went on as normal.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 화재, 싸움, 질병 등이 갑자기 발생하다; 갇힌 곳에서 탈출하다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 예상치 못한 사건이 갑자기 시작될 때 씁니다. 전쟁, 화재, 폭동 등 부정적인 사건에 자주 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: break(터지다, 깨다)와 out(밖으로)이 결합하여 억제되어 있던 것이 밖으로 터져나온다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 갑작스러운 발생이 핵심 뉘앙스입니다. 탈출의 의미로 쓸 때는 break out of ~의 형태로 씁니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: A fight broke out in the parking lot after the game ended.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 경기가 끝난 후 주차장에서 싸움이 벌어졌어요.
